parse.title: List of Nintendo 3DS colors and styles

text.*:
This article's lead section does not adequately summarize key points of its contents. Please consider expanding the lead to provide an accessible overview of all important aspects of the article. Please discuss this issue on the article's talk page. (November 2013)

This following is a list of case colors and styles that have been produced for the Nintendo 3DS family of handheld game consoles produced by Nintendo. Although the system initially launched with only two colors, its lineup has subsequently expanded to incorporate many more color varieties and limited editions, some of which are exclusive to various regions. As such, the list includes all color variations of regular Nintendo 3DS and New Nintendo 3DS, as well as their larger models, the Nintendo 3DS XL and New Nintendo 3DS XL along with the Chinese version, the iQue 3DS XL, and the entry-level versions, the Nintendo 2DS and New Nintendo 2DS XL.

Contents

    • 1.1 Basic colors
    • 1.2 Limited Edition variations
    • 1.3 Charging Cradle colors

Notes
  1. ^ a b c The Nintendo 3DS Aqua Blue color variation was discontinued in Japan on May 2012,[2] in North America on October 2012,[3] and in Europe at an unknown date.[4]
  2. ^ a b The Nintendo 3DS Cosmo Black and Ice White color variations were discontinued in Japan on September 2013.[5]
  3. ^ a b c The Nintendo 3DS Flare Red color variation was discontinued in Japan on October 2012,[7] and in North America and Europe at an unknown date.[4]
  4. ^ a b The Nintendo 3DS Misty Pink and Cobalt Blue color variations were discontinued in Japan on May 2013.[11]
  5. ^ The Nintendo 3DS Cobalt Blue color variation in North America was bundled with Luigi's_Mansion:_Dark_Moon.[18]
Nintendo 3DS color variations
The Aqua Blue version of the Nintendo 3DS. 
The Cosmo/s Black version of the Nintendo 3DS. 
The Flare/Flame Red version of the Nintendo 3DS demonstrated at E3 2010. 
Aqua Blue and Cosmos Black were the only colors available at system's launch in Japan, North America and Europe.
  • The Japanese version of the Nintendo 3DS system in Pure White colour is used in Taiwan and Hong Kong.

Limited Edition variations[edit]

A limited edition The Legend of Zelda Nintendo 3DS system. It was bundled with The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time 3D to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the series. It features golden decals of the series iconic Triforce, along with other adornments.

Nintendo 3DS XL/LL color variations
The Black version of the Nintendo 3DS XL. 
The Blue + Black version of the Nintendo 3DS XL. 
The Silver + Black version of the Nintendo 3DS XL. 
The interior of the system is either black or white, while the front and back of the system are colored in a secondary color.
